summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing the drafting of a motion to dismiss (MTD) related to a GM interlocutory appeal. The emails show coordination on legal work on a Sunday.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email attaching a draft motion to dismiss regarding a GM interlocutory appeal and coordinating with a colleague on the work.

events.title: Drafting of MTD for GM appeal
events.description: Assistant United States Attorneys coordinate via email on a Sunday to draft a motion to dismiss related to a GM interlocutory appeal.

locations.address: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
locations.description: Office location of the Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The document is email correspondence between prosecutors regarding legal work on a GM interlocutory appeal.
The work involves drafting a motion to dismiss (MTD) and occurs on a Sunday, indicating urgency or tight deadlines.
The correspondence originates from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting the 'GM appeal' is related to the Epstein case, possibly involving Ghislaine Maxwell (GM).
